title: 108_hr4810
content: The Act titled "Direct Funding for First Responders Act of 2004" mandates the direct distribution of 50 percent of grant funds to local entities, including local governments and first responders. The allocation of funds to these entities will be based on the approved application for the grant. Covered grants are specified under Section 3 of the Act. Section 2 of the "Direct Funding for First Responders Act of 2004" applies to Department of Homeland Security grants for first responders to prevent, prepare for, respond to, or mitigate terrorist attacks. It includes State Homeland Security Grant Program and Urban Area Security Initiative grants, but excludes non-Department federal grant programs. The curr_chunk discusses fire grant programs, emergency management planning, and assistance grants authorized by various acts and departments, excluding the Department of Homeland Security.
